attributes.comment:
Mr. Chertoff,

I am writing to strongly oppose the exhorbitant fee increases proposed by USCIS.
The increase in immigration applications and related costs over the past few
years should not be covered by individuals and families who often struggle to
meet the requirements of the current fee structure. USCIS should look to the
U.S. Congress to adequately fund the agency and not penalize working families
for the complete failure of the U.S. Government to address the numerous
shortcomings of the agency. Such an excessive fee increase as the one currently
proposed serves only to further divide families and prevent individuals from
remaining in, or coming to, the United States with a legal status. Your
proposal will only exacerbate an already enormous immigration crisis that
continues to divide our country. Request funding for your "improvements" from
Congress - where almost all other government agencies receive their funding.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Regina Jefferies
